results.content: simple, clear, gives a good head start working with joomla!
results.content_html: simple, clear, gives a good head start working with joomla!

results.content: In general, this is a good introductory course to Joomla development and administration. The drawbacks that I see with this course are that there does not appear to be any activity by the author -- either with student interaction, or with resolving the minor course issues. Additionally, there are some mistakes in the presentation of the course, including mislabeled lectures and lectures that appear to get cut off before completion. Too bad on these issues, as this is otherwise a well produced and well done course.
results.content_html: In general, this is a good introductory course to Joomla development and administration. The drawbacks that I see with this course are that there does not appear to be any activity by the author -- either with student interaction, or with resolving the minor course issues. Additionally, there are some mistakes in the presentation of the course, including mislabeled lectures and lectures that appear to get cut off before completion. Too bad on these issues, as this is otherwise a well produced and well done course.

results.content: It was good and the explanations given was clear. But I do not have any cPanel or FTP access. I installed Joomla using Wampserver64. It is working fine according the instructions given. Thanks for the instructions.

results.content:
It seems to be geared towards an audience who has never done anything IT-related before.
I understand that there are people who don't know how to select multiple files on their os but is this course the right place to explain that?
Anyway, in fast forward mode there is some useful info in it.
